DOC.HEADLINE: SWEENEY , HEBERT LEAD TEAM USA TO ANOTHER VICTORY
DOC.TEXT: The Mighty Ducks ' Tim Sweeney scored two goals and Duck teammate Guy Hebert had 41 saves as the United States beat the Czech Republic , 5-3 , Thursday in the World Hockey Championships . Sweeney , Craig Wolanin and Peter Ciavaglia scored in the first_period as Team USA remained unbeaten in three games and virtually clinched a place in next week ' s medal round . The Czechs tied the score , 3-3 , at 5:56 in the third , but Team USA went_up 4-3 when Sweeney scored his second , at 9:01 on an assist from Duck teammate Joe Sacco . At 17:52 , Bill Lindsay of the Florida Panthers scored his third goal of the tournament .
